column4: can anyone help me how to speedup my ubuntu system??? i got AMD sempron 2200 + 128MB and i don't know why its seems so slow on ubuntu
128MB on XP is blazing fast...
Sure, there are several things.
Here are two things to start. 1 install the 686 kernel.  2. Remove several virtual consoles.
no.  Don't remove the 386 kernel.  When you install the 686 kernel, grub is updated to boot to it anyway.
i tried the virtual consoles... im on a login prompt.. how can i get back to my desktop???
how much memory do you have?
is that system near you now and running?
and the next line.  The one that starts with Swap.
next, there is a line that starts with Cpu.  What is the percentage before id
it sounds like that to me.  Anothe 64 meg might even help, based on the numbers you gave earlier.  Do you have any spare memory?
the kernel-686 did improved the speed alittle... then i tried with 256MB and got a little improvement too... apps still loads so slow even the terminal
do you understand what I mean or should I paste examples?
some people just comment the lines out.  But, I like to still have lots of virtual consoles if I switch to run level 3.
not from w32codecs
how can i make it play mp3s or DVDs?? i can't play even mpg
by DVDs, do you mean encrypted ones?
any DVDs
google is your friend here.  I think it is against the law for me to decribe decss and so I won't do that..
i'm only using it on my own small network here.. no need for security..
i want it to act like the crappy windows network neighborhood... is that possible?
